quiz.title: Economics: National Income, GDP, Inflation, and MPC

questions.question: National income is the:
questions.explanation: National income is the total income earned by a country’s factors of production (land, labor, capital, entrepreneurship) in a given period.

questions.question: GDP measures:
options: Welfare of all people in a country
Total value of final goods and services
questions.explanation: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is the total market value of all final goods and services produced within a country in a given period.

questions.question: Inflation caused by the high cost of imported raw materials is:
questions.explanation: Cost‑push inflation occurs when rising production costs (e.g., higher imported raw‑material prices) push up the general price level.

questions.question: MPC stands for:
questions.explanation: MPC (Marginal Propensity to Consume) is the fraction of additional income that households spend on consumption.
